message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to be offering you this incredible product. I believe it holds tremendous value, and I'm confident it can greatly benefit you.  To kick things off, I'm proposing a price of $1,800,000. This is a strong starting point, reflecting the true worth of this opportunity.

Alice, while I appreciate your enthusiasm, $1,800,000 is far above my budget.  I'm very interested in this product, but I can't go higher than $1,300,000. This is a fair price that reflects the product's value to me.

Bob, I understand your position, but $1,300,000 is significantly below its true value. To find a middle ground, I'm willing to come down to $1,650,000. This offer reflects my desire to strike a deal while ensuring a fair return on this valuable product.

Alice, I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, but $1,650,000 is still outside my price range.  I'm sticking with my previous offer of $1,300,000.  This is a fair price considering the value it holds for me.
Bob, I've tried to be flexible, but your offer doesn't reflect the value this product brings. I have other interested parties.  I'm willing to consider $1,550,000 â€“ but this is my final offer.

Alice, while I understand your position, I'm still not comfortable with $1,550,000.  I'm willing to go up to $1,400,000, but I won't go higher. This is a fair offer considering the value it holds for me, and it's the most I can afford.
